title: Two Sum
prompt:
Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return the indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

Return null if no solution exists.

You may assume each input has at most one solution for the tests on this page.
constraintQuestions: Can numbers be negative, or only positive?
Can the array contain duplicate values?
Will there always be a valid solution? If not, what should we return?
Can there be multiple pairs that add up to the target?
Are we allowed to use extra memory (hash map) to optimize time?

walkthrough.title: Structured interview approach
walkthrough.body:
1) Clarify constraints (negatives? duplicates? always a solution? multiple answers?).
2) Create test cases.
3) Describe logic without code.
4) Code carefully.
5) Walk through with a test case.
6) Analyze time & space complexity.
7) Optimize (often using a hash map).

walkthrough.title: Naive approach (two loops)
walkthrough.body:
Outer loop = pointer P1.
Compute numberToFind = target - nums[P1].
Inner loop searches for numberToFind.
Return [P1, P2] when found.
If none found, return null.
Time: O(n^2), Space: O(1).

walkthrough.title: JavaScript (naive implementation)
Optimized approach (hash map)
walkthrough.body:
Use a map from value -> index.
For each element x at index i:
- needed = target - x
- if needed exists in map, return [map[needed], i]
- else store map[x] = i
Time: O(n), Space: O(n).
